meanings.definition: Hesitate or be unwilling to accept an idea or undertaking.
meanings.sent1: She would always baulk at the idea of trying new foods.
meanings.sent2: Don't baulk at the chance to learn something new.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to baulk at the sight of the cucumber on the floor.
meanings.sent4: His fear of failure made him baulk at taking risks.
meanings.sent5: The child's shyness caused her to baulk at speaking in front of the class.

meanings.definition: A beam laid across a horse's stable to support the hay.
meanings.sent1: The farmer placed a sturdy baulk across the stable to hold the hay.
meanings.sent2: The baulk in the stable was essential for storing the hay safely.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous horse tried to balance on the baulk in the stable.
meanings.sent4: The baulk in the stable creaked under the weight of the hay.
meanings.sent5: The old baulk in the stable showed signs of wear from years of use.
